name: Convento do Espinheiro, A Luxury Collection Hotel & Spa

reviews.title: I can't imagine a better hotel experience
reviews.text: On the outskirts of Evora this is an absolute gem. Convento is a beautiful national historic treasure and they have done an amazing job of blending a beautiful historic building and a modern hotel.

reviews.title: Fabulous Historic Monastery now Modern Hotel
reviews.text: The tour given by the concierge staff was fantastic, service overall was exceptional, the wind tasting was delightful and the dining is absolutely wonderful.

reviews.title: Unusual - definitely the place to stay in Evora!
reviews.text: I didn't have my kids with me, but the hotel seemed very family friendly, and I started to plot my return trip the moment I left the building.

reviews.title: Unique building and peaceful ambience close to Evora - but not everything is 5*
reviews.text: Fabulous hotel on the outskirts of Evora, with all the modern ammenities one could wish for, including an inside heated pool and jacuzzi, outside pool with children's pool as well, vast gardens and olive orchards, etc...The hotel manager leads a very interesting tour of this ancient monastery, recently converted into a hotel, daily, followed by a complimentary Portuguese wine tasting. The hotel serves olive oil pressed from its own olive trees. The breakfast is fabulous, with a large sampling of local delicacies, self-serve expresso and capuccino, sparkling wine, made-to-order omelettes, etc...The rooms in the modern section face the gardens and are very nicely appointed. The concierge at the hotel was excellent, making suggestions and reservations for us for tours at nearby vineyards and restaurants.

reviews.title: A beautiful experience in a beautiful place
reviews.text: Evora is a small and almost perfectly preserved walled city in the centre of Portugal's Alentejo - about 80 mins south-east of Lisbon and the same distance from the Alentejo coast to the west or the Algarve to the south - it is relatively quiet for a tourist destination (with a university), with decent and inexpensive restaurants and pastillerias and worth a visit.

reviews.title: I've chose Convento do Espinheiro to get married one year ago...
reviews.text: That just says it all....it's simply perfect.

reviews.title: Just ask and you shall get it!!!
reviews.text: I just hope to be able to come back every year as I've done this year..

reviews.title: An Excellent Experience
reviews.text: Ask the staff for the programmed cultural activities ...you may just get lucky as we had this year as we witness an Opera concert while we dined in the cloisters area.

reviews.title: Spectacular
reviews.text: Don't expect perfection, the entire staff at this proprety are most likelly the best staff in whole Portugal resorts and restaurants. As we all have different needs and wants, just state your wishes and everyone will deliver far behond your expectations.

reviews.title: A nearly hotel
reviews.text: I spend over 200 nights in hotels every year and over 100 at SPG properties and although my familly and I have just arrived here for a 5 days holiday, based on our experiences, I can confidently tell all who will read this post; - this is the perfect place to rest, relax and enjoy true service by people who deeply care about all of us and mostly about doing well and be proud of their performances.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Evora is a beautiful town and Convento do Espinheiro is THE place to stay while visiting.
reviews.title: Beauty, history and luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was friendly and helpful. The surroundings are so beautiful, it seems like it is the THE destination for romance and weddings.
reviews.title: RURAL CULTURE IN COMFORT

reviews.text: We were upgraded to a suite in the old building. It was immense!! Beautifully appointed, the beds, linens, bathrooms and towels are top notch. Sleep quality is quite high as we heard not a sound from any other rooms. Our only problem was that we prefer to sleep with an open window and had mosquitoes pestering us all night on our first night. Screens or a warning would have alleviated this issue and we took further care on subsequent nights
reviews.title: Best hotel in Evora!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds and pool area are quite beautiful and a wonderful place to relax after a day of touring. Our lunch in the courtyard was good but we skipped breakfast as it ran 29 euros/pp. Kinda steep for the simple breakfast we desired.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel - almost perfect
Beautiful Property
reviews.text: The staff was outstanding!! Helpful and professional and happy to offer good advice.

reviews.title: A wonderful and unusual facility!
reviews.text: A former convent converted into a beautiful and luxurious hotel? Yes, and it lives up to all the glowing reviews. The former chapter room is a great bar; the original chapel remains intact in the middle of the hotel for weddings and for. . . well, admiring it; the dining room is in a former cellarium; the thoughtful conversions just go on and on.

reviews.title: An awesome experience, ultimate in unique luxury.....
reviews.text: In addition to the beautiful conversions and the lovely surrounding countryside, the food was scrumptious and the service very good. Warm and attentive, not intrusive. I would say the service was impeccable except for the young man at the bar who stayed glued to the soccer game on TV and needed some real nudging for attention during a big game.

reviews.title: A unique experience
reviews.text: Our room was not one of the glamorous ones featured on the website, but it was lovely and had every amenity. We even had a balcony with a view of some of the hotel's gardens.

reviews.title: A unique experience
reviews.text: I did not take advantage of the spa or the pool, but those who did were very complimentary.

reviews.title: Outstanding
reviews.text: Tip: take advantage of the staff's offer to conduct a tour of the facility. It's well worth the time, because you won't discover half of what the hotel has to offer on your own.

aka: Convento Do Espinheiro, a Luxury Collection Hotel And Spa
